IC_NAME: NATIONAL CENTER FOR COMPLEMENTARY & INTEGRATIVE HEALTH
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Though DNA viruses infect every human, most individuals do not show any initial symptoms, yet others develop complex diseases. Here, we will develop new data science and experimental methods to understand why individuals respond differently to the same infections by mapping the individuals, tissues, and cells that harbor latent viruses. Applications of our new methods will uncover new interactions between the viruses and host genetics, individual cells, and human phenotypes—all key ingredients in understanding the impact of the human DNA virome on health and disease.

IC_NAME: OFFICE OF THE DIRECTOR, NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE: Modernization of SPF Rodent Housing in Shared-Use Animal Facility at Einstein The Albert Einstein College of Medicine Institute for Animal Studies provides comprehensive support for the generation, housing, and analysis of animal models of human disease and transgenic animals used in both basic and translational research relevant to public health. We propose to establish a specialized sub-facility to house immunocompromised, immunodeficient, and transgenic animals used in studies conducted by researchers affiliated with several NIH-funded Centers. In this sub-facility, we will replace racks and static, filter-top cages with new racks that support the use of individually ventilated cages, which will enhance the biosafety of the animal microenvironment by ensuring the adequate flow of sterile air, reduce the frequency at which cages require changing, and increase the overall housing capacity of the facility to meet increasing interest in and usage of preclinical animal model development.

PHR: Project Narrative We plan to initiate participation in the NIH U01 Consortium for Gut-Brain Communication in Parkinson’s Disease (GBPDC) including contribution of patients into the where they will be phenotyped with in depth Parkinson’s and GI measures including clinical symptoms and physiology. Subsets of the cohort will be recruited from the Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) to participate in studies of brain gut imaging to assess meal-induced gut-brain axis and autonomic alterations in PD and another subset will under detailed sleep, circadian rhythm, GI motility pattern assessment to understand the relationship between Parkinson’s disease desynchrony of central and peripheral circadian and sleep clocks with GI dysmotility.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative Loss of neurons that produce the neuromodulatory neurotransmitter acetylcholine in the basal forebrain are correlated with cognitive decline in Lewy Body Dementia, and loss of these neurons is predictive of patients with Parkinson’s Disease developing Parkinson’s Disease Dementia. This project aims to understand how loss of acetylcholine release or signaling in mouse models of Lewy Body Dementia lead to cortical dysfunction and subsequent cognitive decline. The successful completion of this project will not only lead to a better understanding of how cortical dysfunction leads to cognitive decline, but will also lead to a better understanding of how to leverage cholinergic signaling for novel therapeutics in Lewy Body Dementia.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
PHR: Craniosynostosis, premature fusion of skull bones, is one of the most common human craniofacial birth defects. We have created a zebrafish model for one of the genetic defects that causes craniosynostosis in humans, and through study of the zebrafish, aim to better understand the genetic and cellular events that lead to defective skull development. Our findings will aid in providing better counseling to families and in developing more targeted therapies for these patients.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Project Narrative The ability to sustain gene expression homeostasis, is one of the most integral parts of cellular biology but declines with age. In a well-received preprint, the project investigator discovered that most organs of 24 months old mice, and lungs infected with influenza A, display a genome-wide imbalance in the transcript levels encoded by short genes relative to those encoded by long genes. This project will address the regulation of this transcriptome imbalance and its impact on the functional health of the proteome and the multi-morbidity in aged individuals.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
PHR: Project Narrative Acinetobacter baumannii is an important cause of multi-drug resistant nosocomial and combat related infections with high mortality. Immunotherapeutic alone or in combination with drugs can be a solution to prevent and treat MDR Acinetobacter infection. We propose to evaluate the potency of novel chimeric polypeptide vaccines against pneumonic Acinetobacter infection and delineate protective immunity to provide insights into the immunotherapeutic design against this emergent MDR bacterial pathogen.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HUMAN GENOME RESEARCH INSTITUTE
PHR: Realizing the promise of genomic medicine to improve disease diagnosis, predict outcomes, and guide treatment for the entire population depends on engaging and educating individuals from underrepresented and diverse backgrounds. This R25 renewal application proposes to leverage and build on the environment and expertise at UAB to develop the Summer Undergraduate and Postbacc Experiences in Genomic Medicine (SUPER-GM), built off of the foundation from our prior Summer Undergraduate Research Experiences in Genomic Medicine (SURE-GM) program which had 46 scholars from 9 historically black colleges or universities (HBCUs) in the region successfully participate. SUPER-GM is SURE-GM reimagined as a summer program with a year-long possible postbacc extension tailored for HBCU undergraduate students that will provide more scholars with the necessary skills, exposure, and experiences to succeed in graduate and/or professional training in genomic sciences.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Narrative Non-motor symptoms in Parkinson’s disease (PD) are common and burdensome throughout disease course but are not well studied in racial and ethnic minority populations. This study will investigate race and ethnicity differences of non-motor symptoms among Black/African American and Latino populations with PD. The occurrence, treatment, and burden of non-motor symptoms will be evaluated among these historically underrepresented PD populations using observational study and electronic health records data.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative There is currently no effective treatment for motor neuron (MN) disorders in part due to a lack of understanding of the molecular mechanisms that allow distinct MN subtypes to acquire and maintain their function-defining properties. We recently identified several evolutionarily conserved regulatory factors (e.g., UNC-3, BNC-1, PBRM-1) that control MN subtype development and function, and the proposed research will employ cutting-edge methods to illuminate their molecular mechanism of action. Completion of these experiments will advance our understanding of how MNs become and remain functional, aiming to provide key insights into the etiology, diagnosis or treatment of MN disorders.

ORG_NAME: PENNSYLVANIA STATE UNIV HERSHEY MED CTR
PHR: Project Narrative Aging is associated with a decline in cognition and the onset of disabling diseases such as dementia. The current investigation will investigate whether mushrooms consumption is associated with reduced incidence of cognitive decline in a cohort of middle-aged and elderly individuals.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL HEART, LUNG, AND BLOOD INSTITUTE
PHR: This project develops a new approach to monitoring blood pressure in patients with a life threatening condition known as circulatory shock, which can be caused by many causes including heart failure, overwhelming infection, or bleeding. The method uses computational techniques to provide an improved description of the actual perfusion pressure driving blood flow to vital organs during shock, and may therefore be used to guide clinical diagnosis and management of therapies aimed at treating shock. The project will combine studies from preclinical animal models and clinical patients to validate the new approach.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
ORG_NAME: NEW YORK UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Response to immunotherapy remains less than 20% for Oral Cavity Squamous Cell Carcinoma (OSCC). Neurotransmitters of the parasympathetic nervous system, such as Acetylcholine (Ach), can be secreted from non-neuronal tissues, including lymphocytes, which are abundant in microenvironment of OSCC and are essential to mediating responses to immunotherapy. This project aims to understand how non-neuronal Ach signaling maintains the homeostasis of lymphocytes with a goal of uncovering novel targets to improve responses to immunotherapy.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF GENERAL MEDICAL SCIENCES
PHR: Project Narrative: The large double stranded DNA viruses, including herpesviruses and many bacteriophages which are directly responsible for antibiotic drug resistance, bacterial evolution and the ecology of the human microbiome, package their DNA into a capsid shell using a terminase enzyme. We propose studies designed to probe the essential features of genome packaging in these viruses, many of which play major roles in human health, morbidity and mortality. The results of this research will provide a better understanding of virus development a may reveal new targets for novel anti-viral therapeutics.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON DRUG ABUSE
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE The present lack of diversity among addiction researchers presents a range of opportunity costs, from hindered scientific innovation to persistent disparities in treatment outcomes. The Training in Research Undergraduate Experience through the Rutgers Addiction Research Center (TRUE RARC) Scholar Program serves to upskill and diversify the next generation of addiction scientists at the undergraduate level via interdisciplinary coursework, lab internships, and career readiness activities to promote a more diverse addiction research field.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative The overarching goal of the supplement research is to obtain a detailed understanding of the role of oxidative stress in astrogliosis. The aims of the supplement address redox modifications of glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP) and vimentin after endogenous GFAP deletion. The studies can provide mechanistic insights regarding epilepsy-associated astrogliosis.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative There is currently no effective treatment for motor neuron (MN) disorders in part due to a lack of understanding of the molecular mechanisms that allow distinct MN subtypes to acquire and maintain their function-defining properties. We recently identified several evolutionarily conserved regulatory factors (e.g., UNC-3, BNC-1, PBRM-1) that control MN subtype development and function, and the proposed research will employ cutting-edge methods to illuminate their molecular mechanism of action. Completion of these experiments will advance our understanding of how MNs become and remain functional, aiming to provide key insights into the etiology, diagnosis or treatment of MN disorders.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF MENTAL HEALTH
PHR: PROJECT NARRATIVE Electrophysiological recording systems allow direct observation of neural activity in animal subjects. This facilitates the study of crucial neuroscientific topics such as development, learning and memory, and cognition, as well as brain diseases such as Alzheimer’s, epilepsy, Parkinson’s, and depression. LeafLabs’ tools for performing high-channel count electrophysiology experiments in freely-moving rodents will allow researchers to collect and interpret neural data at a large scale, with few experimental constraints to environment complexity or the types of naturalistic behaviors studied.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF NEUROLOGICAL DISORDERS AND STROKE
PHR: Project Narrative  ATP1A3-related disorders are a group of rare genetic conditions caused by mutations in the brain ion pump gene ATP1A3. They are associated with various devastating neurological manifestations, including intermittent paralysis or abnormal posture of the limbs, loss of balance, epilepsy and cognitive impairment, and there is no effective treatment. In this project, we aim to perform the first systematic clinical study of this condition in Brazil and devise new treatment based on RNA therapeutics in this population, which will also benefit many other patients worldwide.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE ON AGING
PHR: Narrative Older surgical patients are at extremely high risk for cognitive and functional decline after hospitalization, and the COPE-iOS study is examining whether a comprehensive program of computerized cognitive training, guided progressive physical exercise, and health education performed throughout the entire perioperative period will improve long-term cognitive and disability outcomes in elderly surgical patients compared to active attention control. Multiple additional factors, including group social support which is provided in the COPE-iOS study, may influence postoperative recovery. The Investigating Functional Outcomes and Cognition thrU Surgery (InFOCUS) study is a prospective observational cohort measuring cognitive and physical outcomes after major surgery in older adults who are receiving usual care to allow better understanding of the efficacy of the combined cognitive and physical exercise program and further knowledge on potential contributions of enhanced systemic support around major surgery.

IC_NAME: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF DENTAL & CRANIOFACIAL RESEARCH
PHR: NARRATIVE Nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) accounts for more than 133,000 cancer cases per year worldwide. The association to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) infection in the tumor is unanimous (~100%) in NPC-endemic areas, and high (90%) in non-endemic areas such as the U.S. This proposal seeks to define the test performance of a prototypic serology assay and to develop a refined high-throughput EBNA1 IgA assay for NPC risk prediction.
